summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to National Registered Agents, Inc. (for Expedia, Inc.) on January 27, 2020, demanding records related to flights purchased, booked, or taken by Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation and a declaration form for a custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and cover letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual whose flight records are being subpoenaed from Expedia as part of a federal grand jury investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a).

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation for which Maxwell's travel records are being subpoenaed.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to Expedia (via its agent) for flight records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production Deadline
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records by this date.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell as of January 2020.
The investigation involved alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which relates to transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity.
The government specifically sought Expedia flight records for Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating a focus on her travel patterns.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested the subpoena recipient not to disclose its existence to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The document shows the procedural step of using a third-party agent (National Registered Agents, Inc.) to serve a subpoena on a corporation (Expedia, Inc.).
